message.content:
cs.CV, cs.LG, cs.GR, cs.AI, cs.CL 

The paper deals with deep learning approaches for 3D shape segmentation, which is a problem related to computer vision (cs.CV). The use of recursive neural networks and the development of a new benchmark for fine-grained segmentation suggest that the paper may also be relevant to machine learning (cs.LG) and graphics (cs.GR). The paper proposes a novel approach for hierarchical segmentation, which involves the use of classifiers to determine the type and stopping criteria of the decomposition, indicating that the paper may also be relevant to artificial intelligence (cs.AI) and natural language processing (cs.CL).
